definition-item.definition-title: HORTICULTURE; CULTIVATION OF VEGETABLES, FLOWERS, RICE, FRUIT, VINES, HOPS OR SEAWEED; FORESTRY; WATERING (picking of fruits, vegetables, hops or the like A01D46/00; propagating unicellular algae C12N1/12)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices and methods for growing, containing and culturing plants.
Chemical compositions or formulations concerning plant growth regulating materials are classified in A01N25/00.
Chemical compositions or formulations concerning fertilizers are classified in C05G.
Chemical composition formulations in general are classified in C08.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Picking of fruits, vegetables, hops or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Plant reproduction by tissue culture techniques
Flowering plants characterised by their plant parts
Flowering plants characterised by their botanic taxonomy
Devices for topping or skinning onions or flower bulbs
Mixtures of one or more fertilisers with additives not having a specially fertilising activity

definition-item.definition-title: Vegetative propagation (plant reproduction by tissue culture techniques A01H4/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Methods of asexual reproduction of plants, i.e. NOT involving seeds.
Methods of vegetative propagation involving specialized plant organs such as:

list-item.paragraph-text: Stolons or runners, used for example by strawberries,
Rhizomes, used for example by ginger, lilies and irises,
Bulbs, used for example by shallots, lilies and tulips,
Root or stem tubers, used for example by (sweet) potatoes, yams and dahlias,
Corms, used for example by gladiolus and taro,
Suckers, used for example by apple and banana trees.

section-body.paragraph-text: Methods of vegetative propagation involving suckering, i.e. transplanting suckers.
Specific apparatus therefor not otherwise provided for.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Plant reproduction by tissue culture techniques

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

list-item.paragraph-text: vegetative reproduction,
vegetative multiplication,
vegetative cloning

definition-item.definition-title: by means of cuttings

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Methods of vegetative propagation wherein a part of the plant, usually a stem or a leaf, is cut off and planted in a growth substrate (illustration in Fig.1).
Specific apparatus therefor not otherwise provided for.

definition-item.definition-title: Layering

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Ground layering methods, i.e. bending of plant branches or stems so that they touch the ground and are covered with soil to induce the development of roots (illustration in Fig.1).

Air layering, or marcotting, methods, i.e. wounding a target region of the plant and surrounding the wound with a lump of moisture-retaining medium to induce the development of roots (illustration in Fig.2).
Specific apparatus therefor not otherwise provided for.

definition-item.definition-title: Grafting (grafting-wax A01N3/04)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Grafting methods, i.e. a part of the plant, called scion, usually a stem or a leaf, is cut off and attached to the stem of another plant called stock or rootstock that remains rooted in the growth substrate (illustration in Fig.1).
Inarching methods, wherein the scion is still attached to its own root system at the time of grafting (illustration in Fig.2).
Specific apparatus therefor not otherwise provided for.
This place does not cover:

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

list-item.paragraph-text: budding

definition-item.definition-title: Automatic apparatus therefor

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus for mechanically grafting plants, operating partly or totally automatically.
Devices for mechanically cutting, inserting or ligating the scion and/or the stock, operating partly or totally automatically (illustration in Fig.1).
Seedling grafting robots (illustration in Fig.2).

definition-item.definition-title: Cutting; Inserting

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus for manually (illustration in Fig.1) or automatically (illustration in Fig.2) cutting the scion and/or stock.
Apparatus for manually or automatically inserting the scion into the stock for joining them into a graft joint.
Methods therefor.

definition-item.definition-title: Holding; Ligating

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus for manually or automatically holding the graft joint in position through ligating or clamping means, e.g. with clamps, clips, etc. (illustrations in Fig.1 and Fig.2);
Methods therefor.

definition-item.definition-title: Cutting implements specially adapted for horticultural purposes; Delimbing standing trees (forestry delimbers A01G23/095)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Tools and machines for cutting plants with the purpose of pruning, trimming, shaping, etc.
Also shredders for plant waste.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Mowers having rotating flexible line cutters
Special adaptation of mowers for carrying by the operator

definition-item.definition-title: {for comminuting plant waste}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Comminuting by cutting implements in general

definition-item.definition-title: having elongated or extended handles

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

definition-item.definition-title: {Manual pruning saws}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Motor-driven saws for pruning or branching}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Chain saws}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Circular saws}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Floral handling

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Handling and processing of cut flowers, tools and machines for making bouquets and wreaths, devices and methods for preserving cut flowers

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for preserving flowers

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices to help preserve cut flowers.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Botany in general

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Information and communication technology for agriculture

definition-item.definition-title: Treatment of plants with carbon dioxide

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The treatment of plants with carbon dioxide in fields.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
The Figure illustrates a ground-to-canopy gaseous media delivery system.
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Greenhouses for treating plants with carbon dioxide or the like

definition-item.definition-title: {with electric lighting}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Illumination means for controlling plant photomorphogenesis, i.e. plant morphology, photoperiodism, or phototropism; for example: illumination means for inducing or delaying flowering, fruiting, bolting, etc.;

Illumination means for varying the light properties other than the propagation direction, depending on the plant cultivated; for example: illumination means with variable wavelength spectrum, intensity, polarization;

section-body.paragraph-text: Illumination systems where illumination is controlled by measurements taken in the plant's direct environment, e.g. by cameras, light sensors, etc. (illustration in Fig.1);
Illumination methods for plants, e.g. lighting recipes (illustration in Fig.2).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Treatment of growing trees or plants, e.g. for preventing decay of wood, for tingeing flowers or wood, for prolonging the life of plants

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Devices for treating or repairing live trees or plants, e.g. injecting devices;
Devices to promote effective flowering of trees or plants.

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates a system for injecting trees.
Figure 2 illustrates an ozone system for agricultural applications.
Chemical compositions or formulations concerning plant growth regulating materials are classified in A01N25/00.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for spraying liquid pesticides on field crops
Devices for dispensing powder on field crops
Preservation or chemical ripening of fruit or vegetables

definition-item.definition-title: Cultivation in receptacles, forcing-frames or greenhouses (of mushrooms A01G18/00; soilless cultivation A01G31/00); Edging for beds, lawn or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Devices and containers for use in cultivation of plants;
Floatable planting containers or receptacles;
Floatable structures to cultivate plants.

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figures 1a and 1b illustrate a floatable planting apparatus.
Figure 2 illustrates a floating wetland cultivation device.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Environmental control chambers for greenhouses, forcing frames or the like
Raised beds; Planting beds; Edging elements for beds, lawn or the like
Roof coverings consisting or two or more layers, at least one of the layers permitting turfing of the roof

definition-item.definition-title: Receptacles, e.g. flower-pots or boxes (self-acting watering devices A01G27/00; hanging flower baskets, holders or containers for flower-pots A47G7/00); Glasses for cultivating flowers

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Containers or devices that hold growing plants, including seeds and seedlings.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates a flower pot with light sources.
Figure 2 illustrates a sectional planting pot.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices or holders for supporting flower pots or cut flowers (e.g. tables, stands, wire hangers, vases, covers for pots)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Containers or packages for living plants; Containers for growing bulbs

definition-item.definition-title: Receptacles for seedlings (growth substrates in block form A01G24/44)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Containers specifically designed for seed germination or seedling or sprout growth.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates a container for growth of cryo-sprouts.
Figure 2 illustrates a seed panel including a substrate layer (26), an adhesive layer (28), a plurality of seeds (24) and a cover (28).
Figure 3 illustrates a plant cultivating device with a plurality of seeds (12) disposed on a plate (14) embedded in a cultivating medium (11).
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Seed or shoot receptacles}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Containers specially adapted to hold an individual seed, seedling or shoot.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1a illustrates a circular seed pack made up of individual seed cases separated from each other by perforations.
Figure 1b illustrates a cross section of an individual seed case of Figure 1a with a seed therein.
Figure 3 illustrates a seed holder receptacle with a seed in position for rapid germination.

definition-item.definition-title: {Receptacles consisting of separable sections, e.g. for allowing easy removal of the plant}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Containers made up of two or more separable pieces;
Containers capable of being opened or separated, e.g. comprising hinged sections, scored lines or tear lines.

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates an openable plant pot.
Figure 2 illustrates a container with a jigsaw puzzle construction.
Figure 3 illustrates pots with tear-away elements.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lines of weakness to facilitate opening or dividing of containers made of paper, e.g. boxes, cartons or trays, into separate parts by cutting or tearing
Containers for living plants; Containers for growing bulbs

definition-item.definition-title: Flat containers for turf, lawn or the like, e.g. for covering roofs

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for cleaning flower-pots

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Devices for cleaning the outer walls of flower pots;
Devices for cleaning and sanitizing the interior of pots.

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
The Figure illustrates a flower-pot washer.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Supports for plants; Trellis for strawberries or the like (stays for trees, props for vines A01G17/14)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Stays for trees, props for vines

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Greenhouses

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Forcing-frames; Lights {, i.e. glass panels covering the forcing-frames}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Low gardening beds, with covering frames like glass panes, for forcing or propagating young plants (illustration in Fig.1).
Covering frames for use in forcing-frames, e.g. glass frames, etc. (illustration in Fig.2).
Important note: the term "light" is an outdated term referring to said glass frames and has nothing to do with artificial lighting (see the Figures below: the "lights" with reference signs 2 and 6).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

list-item.paragraph-text: "forcing frames", "horticultural frames", "garden frames", "cold frames", propagating frames", "hotbeds"

definition-item.definition-title: Shades or blinds for greenhouses, or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Devices {or systems} for heating, ventilating, regulating temperature {, illuminating}, or watering, in greenhouses, forcing-frames, or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Systems or devices for managing the environment in greenhouses, forcing-frames or the like, such as:
Ventilating systems for greenhouses or the like.
Heating systems.
Air-conditioning systems.
Illumination arrangements other than for a lighting treatment of the plant.
Watering arrangements of plants cultivated in greenhouses or the like.

definition-item.definition-title: {Lighting means (with special arrangements for promoting growth A01G7/045)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Spatial arrangements of lamps for controlling the light propagation direction towards the plants, e.g. to increase photosynthetic activity, such as:
Vertical lamp arrays (illustration in Fig.1),
Lighting means for illuminating the bottom leaves,
Movable illumination means, etc.
Illumination systems with structural features for controlling the light propagation direction towards the plants, such as:
Screens, shades in association with horticultural lamps;
Horticultural lamps with lenses;
Horticultural lamps with reflectors (illustration in Fig.2), etc.
Horticultural illumination systems with cooling means (illustration in Fig.3).
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Electric devices {(A01G9/249 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: Sterilising soil by steam

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figures 1a and 1b illustrate a system for steam treatment of soil. Note the steam supply manifolds (36, 38, 40) and the steam outlet tubes (36a, 38a, 40a).
Figure 1c illustrates sources of steam including a steam boiler (50), water tank (52) and generator (54) connected to the steam supply manifolds of Figures 1a and 1b via steam supply lines (16).
Figure 2 illustrates a soil pasteurizing apparatus. Note the plurality of branching tubes (8) and the soil injectors (9).
Apparatus for destruction of noxious animals, other than insects, by hot water, steam, hot air or electricity are classified in A01M19/00.
Apparatus for destruction by steam, chemicals, burning or electricity are classified in A01M21/04.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Protection of plants (greenhouses A01G9/14)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The protection of plants through the use of physical or mechanical arrangements.
Protection of plants using chemical compositions, e.g. biocides or pest repellants, or preserving or maintaining freshness of plants is classified in A01N.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus for the destruction of noxious animals or noxious plants
Coverings around trees forming part of a road

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for generating heat, smoke or fog in gardens, orchards or forests, e.g. to prevent damage by frost

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Chemical aspects of generating smoke or mist
Heating devices in general, see the appropriate classes

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for affording protection against animals, birds or other pests (scaring or repelling devices A01M29/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Cloches

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Providing overhead protection, i.e. canopies, for individual plants

definition-item.definition-title: Devices or methods for influencing weather conditions

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates an apparatus for precipitation of water for rainfall enhancement in water-stressed regions.
Figure 2 illustrates a cloud seeding system using hoses.
Figure 3 illustrates a weather modification vehicle including a flare system capable of burning to create a dispersant which may induce precipitation in target clouds.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dropping or releasing powdered, liquid or gaseous matter in flight, e.g. for fire fighting
Buildings adapted to withstand dangerous influences, e.g. tornadoes, floods
Processes or apparatus specially adapted for producing ice or snow
Adaptations of balloons, missiles or aircraft for meteorological purposes

definition-item.definition-title: Cultivation of hops, vines, fruit trees, or like trees

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: Cultivation of mushrooms

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Organic fertilisers containing added bacterial cultures, mycelia or the like

definition-item.definition-title: Growth guides for fruiting bodies, e.g. paper rolls

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices for guiding the fruiting body, or carpophore, of a mushroom during growth, e.g. to obtain a desired form (illustration in Fig.1).
Paper rolls, paper wraps, wrapping papers, etc. for guiding the carpophores (illustration in Fig.2).
Apparatus for attaching the growth guides to the cultivation containers.
Methods therefor.

definition-item.definition-title: Cultivation of turf, lawn or the like; Apparatus or methods therefor (hand-held edge trimmers or shears for lawn A01G3/06; edging for lawn A01G9/28; lawn-mowers A01D34/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Hand-held edge trimmers or shears for lawn

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Flat containers for turf, lawn or the like
Hand tools for treating meadows or lawns
Machines for treating meadows or lawns
Rollers for consolidating or finishing laid-down unset materials
Removing undesirable matter from roads or like surfaces

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

list-item.paragraph-text: Turf, Sod, Grass, Lawn, Meadows

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus for cutting sods or turfs

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines for lifting and treating soil

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus for cleaning the lawn or grass surface

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates a leaf litter collector with tines and a dumping member comprising a movable plate through which the tines extend.
Figure 2a illustrates a device for removing dew from grassy areas such as golf courses comprising a plurality of beaded lines enclosed within a sheath which is pulled behind a tractor.

Figure 2b illustrates the individual beaded lines of Figure 2a. The "beads" are cylindrical, leaded weights disposed in spaced connection along a resilient, durable strand. The weights maintain the line on the grass to provide continuous dew removal.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Cultivation of specific crops or plants not otherwise provided for

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Plant cultivation for specific plant types;
Cultivation of specific types of crops which are non-genetically modified.

section-body.paragraph-text: Hybridised and transgenic plants are classified in group A01H6/00.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Cereals

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
All cereal crops, e.g. maize.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates an intercropping process with corn rows (8) and soybean rows (9).
Figure 2 illustrates a plant arrangement for improving crop yields with a set distance (36) between corn rows (8).

definition-item.definition-title: {Cannabis}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Plant cultivation of Cannabis sativa.

definition-item.definition-title: Forestry

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cultivation of fruit trees or the like

definition-item.definition-title: Transplanting, uprooting, felling or delimbing trees (delimbing standing trees A01G3/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Felling trees

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Delimbers (A01G23/083 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Manufacture of wood shavings, chips, powder or the like

definition-item.definition-title: Growth substrates; Culture media; Apparatus or methods therefor (for mushrooms A01G18/20)

section-body.paragraph-text: Chemical compositions or formulations concerning plant growth regulating materials are classified in A01N25/00.
Chemical compositions or formulations concerning fertilizers are classified in C05G.
Chemical composition formulations in general are classified in C08.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cultivation of turf, lawn or the like on mats

definition-item.definition-title: in block, mat or sheet form

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Compressed growth substrates, e.g. compressed pots, blocks, slabs, bricks, plugs, pellets, wafers, mats, boards (illustrations in Fig.1).
Growth substrates with a coherent shape, e.g. cured with a binder.
Fig.1: Compressed growth substrates
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Watering gardens, fields, sports grounds or the like (special apparatus or adaptations for fertilising-liquids A01C23/00; nozzles or outlets, spraying apparatus B05B)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
The Figure illustrates a concealed elevated irrigation system. Note sprinkler head (4) at the top of post (2a).
Nozzles, spray heads or other outlets designed to control the volume of flow are classified in B05B1/30.
Arrangements for controlling delivery or spray area are classified in B05B12/00.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Special apparatus or adaptations for fertilising-liquids

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Gravity flow or open channel irrigation ditch systems
Valves; Taps; Cocks; Actuating-floats; Devices for venting or aerating
Program-control systems for sprinkler, irrigation, watering
Control of flow by electric means for fluid materials

definition-item.definition-title: Watering arrangements making use of perforated pipe-lines located in the soil

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Control by humidity of the soil itself or of devices simulating soil or of the atmosphere; Soil humidity sensors}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Soil humidity sensors when used together with a control system (in the field and within greenhouses).
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates a porous medium sensor with a porous tip.
Figure 2 illustrates a soil moisture monitoring system.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Electric devices for heating, ventilating, regulating temperature, illuminating or watering, in greenhouses, forcing-frames or the like
Sensors per se for investigating or analysing materials by determining their chemical or physical properties

definition-item.definition-title: Self-acting watering devices, e.g. for flower-pots

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices for supplying fluid to plants in containers over a period of time without requiring manual or human intervention, except for replenishment of the fluid.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

The Figure illustrates a plant watering apparatus in a suspended orientation over a plant. The plant watering apparatus includes a valve head permitting metering of fluid from the apparatus to the underlying plant.
Christmas tree stands with water reservoirs are classified in A47G2033/1286.

definition-item.definition-title: {Control of self-acting watering devices (Hydroponic system controls A01G31/008)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices to control or alter the flow of water or liquid nutrients to the plant. Controls can be based on sensor readings.
Examples may include, but are not limited to, control of flow rate, volume of fluid or liquid level.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:

Figure 1a illustrates an intelligent gardening system comprising a pot (101) with a moisture probing system (104, 105). The pot (101) has a display (109, 110, 111 or 112) that changes in response to input from the moisture probing system (104, 105).
Figure 1b illustrates the intelligent gardening system of Figure 1a further paired with a mobile device.
Figure 2 illustrates an automated plant watering system.

definition-item.definition-title: {Reservoirs connected to flower-pots through conduits}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Reservoirs including conduits, piping, tubes or channels connecting reservoirs to self-watering flower pots.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figures 2 illustrates an automatic plant and bird watering system.

definition-item.definition-title: {Reservoirs, separate from plant-pots, dispensing directly into rooting medium}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Liquid reservoirs which are disposed to deliver fluid directly into rooting medium to distribute water to the plant. These reservoirs are not an integral part of the plant pot.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: having a water reservoir, the main part thereof being located wholly around or directly beside the growth substrate (A01G27/06 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Liquid reservoirs which are disposed entirely around the growth substrate or which are directly beside the growth substrate without the use of conduits or tubing.
Reservoirs may be an integral part of the plant pot structure or may be separable therefrom.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified this place:
Figure 1 illustrates a self-watering and fertilising pot for plants.
Figure 2 illustrates a plant containerising and watering device.
Figure 3 illustrates a container for growing plants with an integral reservoir.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Self-acting watering devices using wicks or the like having a water reservoir, the main part thereof being located wholly around or directly beside the growth substrate

definition-item.definition-title: using wicks or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Self-acting watering devices with wicks or the like allowing the plant to absorb fluid via capillary action. The wick or other fluid-absorbing medium may be partially submerged in or in contact with fluid, which is transported to the plant or growth medium thereof by the capillary action.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates a mat for water distribution and self-watering of potted plants.
Figure 2 illustrates a plant growing system with wicking material.

If the water reservoir is wholly around or directly beside the container, classification should be made in group A01G27/06. If the reservoir is only underneath the device, then classification should be made in group A01G27/04.

definition-item.definition-title: having a water reservoir, the main part thereof being located wholly around or directly beside the growth substrate

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Self-acting watering devices with wicks (or the like) and a water reservoir, the latter being wholly or mostly around or beside the container.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
The Figure illustrates a watering system with a reservoir surrounding the flower pot with a wick inserted therein.

Where the reservoir is both underneath and around or directly beside the growth medium, classification should be made in group A01G27/06. If the reservoir is only underneath the device, then classification should be made in group A01G27/04.

definition-item.definition-title: Root feeders; Injecting fertilisers into the roots

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
In addition to root feeders and injecting fertilisers into the roots also irrigating or fertilising very close to the roots.

definition-item.definition-title: Soilless cultivation, e.g. hydroponics (growth substrates therefor A01G24/00; cultivation of seaweed A01G33/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Cultivation of plants in absence of soil. Plants are grown in air or liquid, e.g. nutrient solution, or some non-soil growth medium.
This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: {Control or regulation thereof}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Soilless cultivation having systems to control or alter nutrient properties, including, but not limited to, flow rate, volume of fluid, liquid level or control of valves. Controls can be based on sensor readings, including, but not limited to, control according to requirements of the plant.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
The Figure illustrates a hydroponic apparatus including controls for pressure, temperature and air flow rate.
This place covers control or regulation of the hydroponic system alone, i.e. not of its enclosure, e.g. a greenhouse, which is to be classified in A01G9/24.
Control and regulation of CO2 to field plants are classified in A01G7/02. Control and regulation of CO2 to plants within a greenhouse are classified in A01G9/18.
Special lighting recipes, e.g. tailormade instructions for lighting designed to help achieve the best results for a specific crop and at specific conditions, are classified in A01G7/045.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Control of the pH, composition, temperature or viscosity of the fluid}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Soilless cultivation systems to:

list-item.paragraph-text: Control or alter pH of the nutrient solution;
Control or alter the composition, i.e. proportions (e.g. PPM) or types of nutrients within the fluid, of the nutrient solution;
Control or alter the temperature of the nutrient solution; or
Control or alter the viscosity of nutrient solution.

section-body.paragraph-text: Nutrient dosing systems.
Fluid heating or cooling systems.
pH buffering systems, including pH sensors and/or systems for supplementing nutrient solution with buffers, acids or alkali, for the purpose of maintaining a target pH or pH range.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates a hydroponic monitor and controller apparatus.
Figure 2 illustrates an automatic nutrient solution circulation system.
Chemical compositions or formulations concerning plant growth regulating materials are classified in A01N25/00.
Chemical composition formulations in general are classified in class C08.
Control or modification of other nutrient solution properties, such a flow rate or volume, are classified in group A01G31/008.

definition-item.definition-title: Special apparatus therefor (self-acting watering devices A01G27/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates a gas driven hydroponic system with a gas line, liquid chamber and flapper valve.

Figure 2 illustrates an orchid cultivating device. Note flower stalk supporters (30), spray tube (15), guard members (20, 21, 22) forming a special container, sphagnum moss (31) within the container and trough (14).
Figure 3 illustrates a planting system with a seed nutrient substrate within a Styrofoam body.
Floating containers for cultivation of plants on outdoor bodies of water are classified in group A01G9/00.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus for cultivation in receptacles or greenhouses in general
Flower-pot saucers with channels or gutters, e.g. for hydroponics

definition-item.definition-title: {Hydroponic cultivation combined with culture of aquatic animals in a symbiotic environment}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Aquaculture and hydroponic systems integrated together.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates an automated, modular, self-contained, aquaponics growing system and method.
Figure 2 illustrates an anti-algae saline aquaculture system.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Receptacles for live fish, e.g. aquaria; Terraria

definition-item.definition-title: {Growth chambers for large-scale hydroponic cultivation, mountable or transportable on site, e.g. shipping containers or prefabricated units}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Large, usually commercial, hydroponic installations built within shipping containers or other often portable or wheeled storage containers.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates a high-density horticulture growing system.
Figure 2 illustrates a closed farm system with air flow control.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for heating, ventilating, regulating temperature or watering, in greenhouses, forcing-frames or the like

definition-item.definition-title: {Hydroponic cultivation wherein the roots of the plants are partially exposed to air, e.g. aeroponics}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices in which the roots are partially suspended in air while nutrient solution is delivered to them.

definition-item.definition-title: {wherein a nutritive solution is supplied in the form of fine drops or mist}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Means for supplying atomized nutrient solution to the roots of a plant, usually using a nozzle or spraying device;
Fogponic devices.

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates a system for germination, propagation and growing plants in ultrasonic-fog conditions (aeroponics).
Figure 2 illustrates an aeroponic recycling system.

definition-item.definition-title: {wherein a shallow stream of nutritive solution is circulated along the roots, e.g. nutrient film technique [NFT]}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Cultivation wherein plant roots are continuously exposed partially to a shallow layer of nutrient solution housed in a channel- or gutter-type of receptacle, e.g. "Nutrient Film Technique".
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates a nutrient film technique system.
Figure 2 illustrates a system for growing crops using a growing trough.

definition-item.definition-title: {with periodic flooding of the roots, e.g. ebb-and-flow or flood-and-drain techniques}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Intermittent flow or supply of nutrient solution to completely submerge roots of plants, e.g. supplying a solution to plant roots for immersion thereof for a period of time, then subsequently draining the solution.
Periodic flooding by moving plants themselves into a nutrient solution for root submersion thereof.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:

Figure 1 illustrates a hydroponic grow tube. Note the arrows (44) indicating the direction of flow through the tube. Hydroponics medium flows in via tee (34) through fill plug (46) and exits via drain pipe (28). The height of drain pipe (28) may be changed to adjust the fluid level height in the grow tube.
Figure 2 illustrates a device for temporarily immersing crops in a liquid substrate.

definition-item.definition-title: {Hydroponic cultivation wherein the roots are totally immersed in the nutritive solution, e.g. cultivation on floating rafts or deep-water culture}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Hydroponic growth systems having means for supporting a plant in a nutrient solution whereby its roots are continuously submerged in the nutrient solution.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
The Figure illustrates a hydroponic growing system with floatable containers.
Hydroponics systems in which plant roots are only periodically or only partially submerged are classified in A01G31/0232.
Containers floating on an outdoor body of water are classified in A01G9/00.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Hydroponic cultivation wherein the roots of the plants are partially exposed to air, e.g. aeroponics

definition-item.definition-title: {Hydroponic cultivation for vertical cultivation (on racks or in stacked containers A01G31/06)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Plants supported in a vertical fashion by a growth tower or other vertically-extending structure.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Hydroponic culture on racks or in stacked containers

definition-item.definition-title: Hydroponic culture on conveyors

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Hydroponic cultivation including means for moving plants.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates a conveyor belt for moving plants through a packing room where they are packaged by workers into packaging (P).
Figure 2 illustrates a vertical farming system.

definition-item.definition-title: Hydroponic culture on racks or in stacked containers

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Vertically-extending arrays of plants, either supported by a rack and shelving unit, or by individual containers stacked one on top of the other.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates a plant-growing system with stacked containers.
Figure 2 illustrates an indoor rack hydroponic cultivation system.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {with means for recycling the nutritive solution}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Hydroponics systems with means for recirculating or recycling the nutrient solution supplied to plants.
An example includes, but is not limited to, a closed loop system with collection of drained effluent from plants and re-supply of such effluent to the plants.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates a high-density cultivation system with a capture reservoir (130) for recapturing nutrient solution and delivering the nutrient solution back to the nutrient reservoir (110).
Figure 2 illustrates a water culture apparatus with a circulation device for recycling the nutritive solution.
Figure 3 illustrates cultivation tank (10) coupled to cultivation tank (20) via siphon tube (30) and a storage tank (50) coupled to cultivation tank (20) via siphon tube (40).
Storage tank (50) is coupled to the cultivation tank (10) via a circulation pipe (60) to complete a circuit for recycling nutritive solution.
